profileText: A Representative from Kentucky; born in New Liberty, Owen County, Ky., February 22, 1865; attended Concord College, New Liberty, Ky., and Georgetown College, Georgetown, Ky.; deputy sheriff; member of the Democratic State central committee and of the State executive committee; high sheriff of Owen County 1892-1896; unsuccessful candidate for State auditor in 1899; engaged in banking and in the tobacco business; elected as a Democrat to the Fifty-sixth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the death of Evan E. Settle and served from January 15, 1900, to March 3, 1901; resumed his former business activities; died in Owenton, Ky., on August 5, 1942; interment in New Liberty Cemetery, New Liberty, Ky.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by death of Evan E. Settle, and took his seat January 15, 1900

researchRecord.name: In the Miscellaneous Materials, 1846-ca. 1930, 2 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The materials include a sheriff's tax book of June W. Gayle, used to record payment of taxes (1890 - 1893).

researchRecord.name: 1900-1942, 0.2 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The collection of June Ward Gayle consists of a scrapbook and other materials, most of them relating to his career. Included are a scrapbook of newspaper clippings, mostly about June Ward Gayle's election to Congress and his later career in banking, some loose news clippings, a typescript story about an old-fashioned fair held in New Liberty, Ky., and two election badges. The book in which the news clippings are pasted is a printed memorial to June Gayle's predecessor, Evan E. Settle. Some of the news clippings relate to other members of the Gayle family.

researchRecord.name: 1900-1942, 1 microfilm reel.
researchRecord.description: This microfilm reel is a copy of a scrapbook of newspaper clippings about June Ward Gayle's election to Congress and his later career. The book containing the news clippings is a printed memorial to Evan Settle, June Gayle's predecessor. Some of the news clippings relate to members of the Gayle family.
